# Tender Notice: Organic Waste Collection and Composting
## Project Overview
The Correctional Service of Canada, Ontario Region Institutions, is seeking a qualified contractor to collect and process organic waste at various correctional facilities throughout the region. This project aims to reduce the environmental impact of waste management and promote sustainable practices.

## Project Schedule
The contract period is expected to run from October 1, 2022, to September 30, 2023, with the option to renew for two additional one-year periods. The successful bidder will be required to collect and process organic waste on a regular basis, adhering to specific schedules and standards.

## Project Requirements
The contractor will be responsible for providing bins of sufficient size and quantity to hold organic waste accumulated at the designated collection sites. The contractor must also ensure that all waste is processed into a commercial-grade compost product.

## Selection Criteria
The selection criteria for this project include:

* The contractor's ability to provide a reliable and efficient waste collection service
* The contractor's experience in collecting and processing organic waste
* The contractor's familiarity with waste management regulations and standards

## Evaluation Method
The evaluation method for this project includes:

* The contractor's technical bid, which will be evaluated based on the contractor's experience, qualifications, and technical capabilities
* The contractor's financial bid, which will be evaluated based on the contractor's pricing and payment terms

## Contracting Authority
The Contracting Authority for this project is the Correctional Service of Canada, 340 Laurier Ave W, Ottawa, Ontario K1P 0P9, Canada.

## Contact Information
To obtain more information about this project or to submit a bid, please contact:

Jason Scott, Contracting Authority, at (613) 328-9380 or Jason.Scott@csc-scc.gc.ca.

## Important Dates
The tender closing date is 2022-09-09T14:00:00. The corporation reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers and may award the contract to the bidder who best meets the requirements.

## Attachments
Please see the attachments for further information about this project, including the solicitation document and associated documents.

## Language
Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French). Bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process.
